p: The conidia suspension of the fungi were prepared according to the method described by Hao [ 14]. The healthy P. notoginseng seedlings were submerged in a conidial suspension containing 1 Ã— 10 6 cfu/mL for 2 h. Then the negative control plants were treated with the sterile water. After infection, the P. notoginseng plants were continually cultivated in the greenhouse. After approximately 20 days of growth, the numbers of P. notoginseng diseased plants were counted. The mycelium and conidia of the two pathogens were put into a temporary slide for microscopic observation. Then the morphology of hyphae and conidia were observed under optical microscope (Olympus Corporation, Tokyo, Japan).
